text: right Luigi Luiggi (born 3 August 1856 in Genoa - 1 February 1931 in Rome) was an Italian engineer and politician. He was a senator for the Italian parliament. He led the Cabinet on the Ministry of Public Works from 1892 to 1893. He received the Order of the Crown of Italy and French Legion of Honour. ==References== Category:Italian architects Category:1856 births Category:1931 deaths Category:People from Genoa Category:Members of the Senate of the Republic (Italy) Category:Recipients of the Legion of Honour Category:19th- century Italian politicians Category:20th-century Italian politicians
title: Luigi Luiggi
